textBeforeTable: The major amount of rainfall is during the South-West monsoon and / or North-East monsoon and the normal rainfall is 1157 mm. The statistical data of the district Adilabad is as follows. textAfterTable: MM     I. COMPLETED PROJECTS :     A. Major Projects:Nil     B. Medium Irrigation Projects:     1. Denkada anicut :     The Denkada Aniuct was constructed across Champavathi River . The Project is located near Saripalli village, Nellimarla Mandal, Vizianagaram District to irrigate a total ayacut of 5,153 acres in the District. The project was constructed during 1965-68.     The Project utilizes 0.640 TMC of the available water     The Cost of the project is Rs. 0.390 Crores (SSR of 1967-68)     A total amount of Rs. Crores has been spent towards rehabilitation and the Ayacut of 5153 Acres has been stabilised in Denkada & Bhogapuram Mandals of Vizianagaram District.     An amount of Rs. 50,000 was provided in the Budget Estimate for 2003-04 towards maintenance (under Non Plan Head).     2. Thatipudi Reservoir:     Thatipudi Reservoir Project was constructed across Gosthani River. The Project is located near Thatipudi village, Gantyada Mandal, Vizianagaram District to irrigate a total ayacut of 15,378
